But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you must determine this, now you should examine it and dry it as we have recommended, unless you find any cause to spare a vein or nerve or major limb as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed to you and there is corruption or blackness in it, now you should excise that until all the corruption is removed; then treat it with what will make flesh grow until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and pus continues to discharge as before, then you will know that you have not completely eradicated the corruption; at that point, uncover it again and carefully examine and clean it thoroughly with your last effort, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if you are healed, that is good; and if not, then know that that corruption is in the depth of the body, which has not been reached, and thus in that there is nothing to do but to treat that.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted part is small, or it is possible for you to remove that, then at that time you should remove it with fine forceps, which are suitable for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if some bones are involved, then carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and do not leave any of them due to your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any cause of the humidity opposes you, and in their incision there is no fear or error, then incise those tissues or flesh where necessary, and expose the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if it is not possible for you to remove the bones at this time, then apply something that can alleviate the condition on the wound, and leave it be until such a time when there is flesh and tissue around those bones, and guard against the wound becoming consolidated, and ensure that the section you incised during your operation does not become constricted.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Having said that, if you are concerned, apply a cloth submerged in warm oil, or a cloth soaked in Egyptian ointment, or one of the green ointments, because when these plasters will be applied, and the tissues and bones are separated by their removal, and from those the attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the bone of a camel or cow or similar, and what is corrupted on it is only its surface, then scrape that with a scraper only from behind until that blackness and corruption is removed, and then repair the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If what is from the bone has become corrupted and a large part of it is decayed, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that area and entirely cut within the place where the corruption has spread, and then treat it until it becomes consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you what happens to a person in his condition, so that you use this as an example and assistance for your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man around xxx years old experienced pain in his body, and the part affected inside is near the internal matter of the body that has reached the cavity, and this matter has become a large abscess, and it is not due to an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the condition extended over time due to the error of the physicians when the abscess was not properly treated, and it became filled with pus, and his recovery was delayed until the cavity became fistulated, and there were multiple openings through which they discharged pus and the moisture of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then many doctors treated him for about two years, and none of them had the knowledge or skill in the art until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the cavity and the matter that was flowing from those openings in large quantities; and already the body of that man was completely emaciated, and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted a probe into one of those openings and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I quickly examined all the openings and found that they reached all parts of the cavity.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I cut open and incised around one of the openings through which I could see a part of the bone, and found that portion corrupted; it was already earthy and decayed and blackened, and also a part of the marrow cavity into which it had penetrated was corrupt.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I tied up what was revealed to me and prepared the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I cut out that corruption from the bone without harming it, which I had previously exposed and tied up.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And subsequently, I treated the wound with restorative medicine for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I repeated the procedure and discovered further corruption on the bone beyond the initial exposure.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I tied up what appeared to me from that corruption, and then I attempted to perform the cure and restoration, but it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	Then I discovered another area and did not stop incising the bone little by little specifically to perform its restoration, and it was not restored until I incised around one palm's width of it, including that part with the marrow, and then I treated it with medicines, and it healed quickly and became healthy.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it was not necessary to repeat the operation and section of it except due to the condition of its fever and for its poor tolerance and fear of death, because it suffered at all times from excessive syncope and malaise.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And thus, he was completely healed, and there is no soft flesh in place of the bone; his condition improved within his body, and his strength returned; he recovered his disposition and did not experience contrary effects during movement or from any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	If there is a protruding bone in the injured area of the body, then you should proceed as follows: take some bandages and secure them at the end of that prominent bone; and order someone to extend it straight; and place another bandage made of thicker wool on top of the first one; and apply this over the flesh below the bone, extending its ends so that you can pull the skin towards the sides; then you will uncover the skin in the area where you want to make a suture so that the needle does not injure the skin.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a stick or board under the bone appropriately, for when you do this, it is not forbidden for the needle to cut through the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the suture be placed over the corrupted area little by little, for if corruption occurs in the concavity of the bone and does not appear in its appearance to the touch, forcing the suture from the other side.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not prominent, and one part continues to the other, with the corruption in the middle or some part of it, then you must uncover the skin entirely from all sides; and place a stick underneath, and then suture the first part where the corruption is until the suture continues from the other side.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the suture be placed according to the location of the corruption, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and suture the bone where it continues from the other side.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not within reason but is abnormal.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is difficult; however, you must investigate the corruption according to how it appears to you, and you should excise that part, and cleanse that part in whatever manner is possible for you, and each joint should be corrected by you, so long as no veins or nerves are harmed.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you should know which saws and chisels are suitable for cutting these bones according to the situation of the bones, their preparation, their thickness, their fineness and size, their hardness and rarity; therefore, it is necessary that you prepare every kind of instrument appropriate for each operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you should know that this operation implies the kind of instrument which you need; when you have great study and long experience in the methods of this art, and knowledge of ways to treat illnesses, then you will already possess yourself what is appropriate for each tool for every illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I inform you at the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will need as basics, among which you will proceed with your restrictions that you will test on others.
Forma de serra:	Form of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw: 
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Form of a rod:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this rod be shaped like the head of a star-shaped key, and let its points be in the form of crescent points.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not sufficient unless the heads of the joints are rubbed with them when they are corrupted, or if the mouth is large and wide.

Form of another saw made properly: let it be made with the strongest part as the bow, and the sharpness from iron, and the handle part like a decently made knife.

Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another cutter; this resembles a rod, and its tip is like a saw, and it is displayed in suitable words according to the ratio of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of the probe which is suitable for probing through the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the tip of it is triangular and has a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian steel, and apparently it suits all the causes we have mentioned regarding knives, scissors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	About the cutting of extremities and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Extremities may need to be amputated either due to intrinsic or extrinsic causes; or when you have treated that corruption with the cure of those medicines and the treatment does not succeed, or sometimes the corruption spreads from the limb without any cause being perceived, then it is necessary for you to cut off that limb up to where the corruption reaches, so that the patient may escape either by this lesser death or by malice which is a more severe punishment of the body.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of the one to whom this happens is that the limb turns black as if it were burnt by fire, or you may see the blackness spreading before the putrefaction reaches that member which is dry and causes the entire body to seize up; therefore, cut off that part for amputation.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the corruption is caused by the bite of certain venomous creatures such as a scorpion, viper, or rattlesnake and similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or bite is on the tip of a finger, then you should amputate the finger and not give space for the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it affects the hand, then you should amputate at the wrist joint, and do not give space for the corruption to spread into the elbow of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you encounter that, then cut the arm at the joint in the collarbone.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if corruption spreads around the collarbone and the condition worsens there, then death is imminent for the patient; and applying another treatment in this case requires an appropriate amount of efficacy.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, when corruption spreads to the foot, then you should cut it at one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it affects the entire foot, then you should amputate the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it spreads to the toe, then you should cut the joint at the base of the toe.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the toe, then there is no remedy but dismissal, and letting the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of cutting off a limb or binding it is that you tie a ligature above the part where you wish to cut, and place another ligature over the area; extend one ligature below the part, and have another extended by an assistant above; then separate the flesh which lies between two ligatures with a spatula until all the flesh is exposed; after this it can be either cut or bound.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to cover the area with a cloth from all sides so that it does not touch the affected site, and to ensure that the patient receives appropriate care and treatment for abscesses.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs while you are working, then you should immediately cauterize the area, or apply some powder to staunch the blood; and then return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Apply bandages to the affected limb appropriately, and take care of it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you what happened to a man in his house, this year an accident which I and to you recommend, the one that was inflicted on him by burning, similar to combustion from fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption spread initially on his hand and then tended to affect the entire body.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared himself for death because he feared that the limb would not recover due to the intensity of the pain and burning, and he allowed that foot to be amputated at the joint, and it healed with fire.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that same corruption affected his finger on the hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I instructed him to purge that excess with the medicines I prescribed, focusing on cleansing his body from it; but the excess was not purged and began to spread to another finger starting from the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to amputate his hand, but I refused to do so, hoping for the purging of that excess, and fearing that the amputation of his hand might lead to death, as the power of the infection was very strong.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his hometown and it was reported to me that the man prepared himself and amputated his entire hand, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have included this narrative only to assist with understanding this illness and to serve as an example for how such cases should be handled.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of hemorrhoids and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy member and the space of the abscess is extended inward so as to form a collection of pus, and it bursts and becomes perforated, and the pus is discharged from there, leaving the place empty like a vessel, and the skin that covers it remains thin like cloth, and has not reached such an extent of corruption as to affect the bone or nerves or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space extends inward so that the corruption affects some member, it is then called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The treatment for it is to incise that skin completely as it is swollen, and especially when it becomes thin like cloth, and ensure that you do not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you hope that the skin will adhere and that the corruption has not reached an advanced stage, and there is a passage in the skin, then you should treat it with enemas.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And when you consider the sinus, if it is large and the arm with which you are treating it has a foul odor, then treat it with an Egyptian medication consisting of oil, vinegar, and raisin in equal parts, and mix them in a vessel over the fire until the medicine becomes thick like honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take the amount that is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; use this to treat the sinus with an enema, plug the opening of the sinus, and leave the medicine inside for the duration of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Take out that which is held in disdain; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the pus is evacuated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is given as an enema with water of ashes, when that medicine is not at hand; and you should take the ash of wheat, put it over the water; and then strain that, and give that as an enema until you are confident that the sinus is now closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then give an enema with water and honey mixed thoroughly three times, and give another enema with vinegar and honey mixed, for the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and the vinegar causes the sinus to adhere, especially when the vinegar has a preponderance of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this for several times and are confident that the sinus is now cleansed, then give an enema with water that promotes flesh growth.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take of the decoction of dyafinicon and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent vinegar; or give an enema with several medicines and other decoctions that have the properties which I have already written about in the chapter on decoctions.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow such that the enema tube cannot be received, then you should gradually enlarge it with a small instrument, and pause in the dilation wrapped in Egyptian medicine or basilicon decoction until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the orifice is too large, then you should sew together the edges with a suture and leave it in such a quantity that the enema can be introduced without additional addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of the one through which the arm drains is raised to the upper parts, then dry that in the pus-filled place that is there where the arm passes underneath, for when the arm is compressed at the depth of the bend the flesh will be generated there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the sinus underneath in the vicinity of the pus as you wish, then perforate so that you prepare the member with preparation by which the arm drains lightly as you are equipped and so that nothing in it impedes the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are applied to the sinus appropriately so that you can extend them over linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the linen should be of such quantity as covers all of the sinus; and then incise with scissors along the edge of the sinus opening a strip somewhat larger than the sinus opening; and then extend over another piece of linen the ointment according to the length of the strip, and place it over that in position distant from the sinus opening so that the movement of the arm is not hindered by the large piece of linen but only after some days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the sinus opening, which you must change at all times so that it dries what is adhering to the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know whether what drains from the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And with this, you should consider the location of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and whether there is an abscess there.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the material which is placed over the sinus opening has adhered or is about to adhere, then on the third day you loosen it, and when you loosen the dressing, then change the cloth and renew the application.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if the sinus has become empty of subtle pus, then do not despair of its adherence, for its healing is imminent, since some people take a long time to generate flesh in their dressings, and others are the opposite.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus there has been evacuated for many days thick undigested matter, then you know that the sinus will not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and becomes prolonged, then adjust to the drying properties of the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, they should be dried as well when applied, adjusting for any excess addition of grease.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the best medicine for curing it is to take a finely ground powder and dissolve it in rose oil, and apply it with something clean that has been used before for this purpose, and use that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it appears in this action, when there is no thick matter, to take fine powder and honey that has been cooked until it thickens, and use it; or take myrrh, aloes, and fenugreek, mix them all together, and sprinkle over the honey which is on the fire, and then apply this over a cloth and strengthen it onto the sinus; or line with the honey you have cooked to thicken, sprinkle over a cloth, and apply that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	For some wounds, administer the long and sharp-pointed lily (and it is the celestial lily) and flour of oats and centaury, and use these simples or mixtures, triturate them and sieve, then powder over the honey which is recommended; and thus use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinew is prolonged and does not heal with this treatment, then you will know that the corruption is in its root, and it has spread to the bones or other hard members or to the ligaments; now treat it with fistula treatment as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of paronychia and worn nails, and on cutting an added finger joint and sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is an abscess that arises from under the nail of a toe or finger of the hand or foot, and it can also occur in other fingers. When it becomes prolonged and its treatment is delayed, it can become an abscess of an already inflamed area, or it may corrupt, causing pus to ooze inside which corrodes the root of the nail. It often corrupts the entire nail, and sometimes spreads to the bone inside, producing a foul odor, and the extremity of the finger or toe becomes blackened, and its color turns dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have done what we have said in the division and do not see improvement in your treatment, then it is necessary that you incise with a scalpel all the superfluous tissue that is rotten from the nail and promptly cauterize the wound thereafter, for prompt cautery is helpful in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the addictions of the nail have already compressed the flesh inwardly, causing pain, then it is necessary that you apply a fine probe under the angle of the nail where the flesh hurts, and push it up and incise that flesh with ease, and place over what remains of the flesh corrosive medicines until it is completely removed; and thereafter treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already penetrated the bone, now is the time for you to incise the bone and extract it, because there is never a cure when the bone is corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption spread to the finger, now you should incise it at one of the joints as is prescribed in its treatment, and then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	However, if there is an injury such as a puncture or bruise to the nail, and there is severe pain in that area, you should initially bleed the patient at the beginning, and then dry the nail with a sharp instrument in a transverse section from above downward, but be careful not to cut into the flesh below the nail, for this would cause the patient severe pain and lead to the formation of excess scar tissue in that location; then treat that area with something that relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	However, in the case of a finger that is swollen, which often occurs in many people, it is mostly filled with flesh, and there is little bone or nail within.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them arise at the root of the joint, or the swelling is in some joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	However, what arises in some joints of the finger is not serious, whereas what arises at the joints is more serious.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are fleshly swellings, the incision is shallow, and you should cut it behind its root with a broad instrument.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	However, for what arises at the root of the joint, treatment is difficult; therefore, be careful not to amputate it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	In that which is called the cutting of the navel string, you should incise the flesh at the beginning with a round incision into the bone, and then use one of those saws suitable for this purpose, and thereafter treat that so that it may heal.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	In the consolidation which occurs between their moving bones or due to the birth of a person who is born in this manner, or due to the healing of an injury or burning by fire, or similarly, then you should treat that consolidation until the said bones return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between their edges in rose oil so that they do not consolidate too quickly, and separate them, or place between them a thin sheet of lead until they are consolidated as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in some of those at the palm, then you should treat that consolidation according to how it is prepared and fit for the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding the incision of veins, these are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins that are varicose, and veins wrapped thickly filled with melancholic superfluities which flow into the joints of the body, and their primary occurrence is in the legs, especially in the legs of travelers, workers, and those who carry loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer purgation of the body with black hellebore several times for strong expulsion, and thereafter let blood from the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of these with iron is according to two methods: one is that they are incised and the black blood drawn out, and the other method is that the vein is raised and entirely extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The section on this is as follows: at the beginning, pour in warm water so that the thick blood is dissolved, which appears cloudy in the basin, and then lift the patient's limb to the most pus-filled part of the wound below the joint with a bandage, and then cauterize the vein in one place or two, or three with extensive cautery, and then elevate the black blood under the hand at the lower part of the wound upwards, until as much blood is released as you wish and as often as suffices, and which the strength of the patient tolerates.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then give him that, and order him to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And iterate the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and inform the patient about this.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation is done in this manner: if you see that the patient's skin is covered with hair, then bathe him and pour warm water on his basin so that it reddens and the veins become prominent; or exercise him vigorously if a bath is not available, until the limb becomes heated.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cauterize the area on the right side of the vein with cautery either above the joint if necessary, or lower down near the heel if needed.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then pierce the area with hooks and strip the vein from all sides until it becomes apparent, and do this according to how much you need, declining towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And thus when you expose it, take the white part that seems like a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And place the patient lying down with their thigh raised and bent at the hip, and suspend it with a cloth sling.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section near that one for three reasons, and then expose the thigh above the vein that appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then raise it and incise that in the rear section towards the heel, and then extract it and elevate it until it exits through the second section, and then extract it from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract it from the section that is highest or farthest from all the sections, until it has completely exited; and now incise it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not follow the method of extracting and elevating it, now insert a strong double-threaded needle and ligate it to extract it, or insert it below the thigh and rotate your hand in all directions until it is dislodged.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; for if it is severed, it will become difficult to elevate it, and the patient will suffer harm from that injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have completely brought it out, now place on the wound wool submerged in wine and rose oil and unrose oil, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vessel is contracted with twists for which there is wrapping in the parts, and it is not straight as we have said, then you must cut along those twists and at the places where it is wrapped, and then suspend it with hooks until you raise it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And guard yourself in your section that you do not incise the vein and that you do not obstruct it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and serve your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incident by which the operation is performed:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of applying poultice:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It should not be as sharp as the edges of a poultice nor have a pointed end so that it does not obstruct the vein; and it should be of great flexibility, for if it were thin, it would cut the vein because of its thinness; however, it should not be overly thick either, as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the thighs in warm lands such as Al-Ategi in the land of Arabia and in hot, dry lands of India where no grass or crops grow.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And this vein is generated in other parts of the body besides the thighs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its formation is from putrefaction that occurs below the skin, just as worms and vermin come from within the body, generating between the skin and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the occurrence of this vein is that inflammation happens suddenly in the thigh; and near the area, blisters appear; and soon the vein begins to emerge from the place of those blisters, resembling a plant sprout.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the end of it appears, you should then wrap around it a piece of lead weighing one dram to two drams, and attach that area and let the lead hang from the thigh.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And so many times when you find some cause in the parts outside, wrap that with lead and wool.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if a wound is long, then you cut one part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not cut that part too deeply until it has healed outwardly, for if you cut too deeply, it contracts inwardly into the flesh and causes an abscess and putrefaction in the place and a bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For it must be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely removed from the rear of it and there remains no cause for it in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And this vein is found in some people extending to a length of five palms and I have heard that it has reached up to twenty palms in length.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert the reed into the tract of it and pierce that one along the length of the body until everything that is in the matter has been evacuated, and treat the area with putrefaction for several days with medicines; and subsequently cure that one according to the treatment of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has multiple openings, especially when it appears at the junction of the foot or on the foot, and it comes out through multiple openings, and is branched from each opening.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat that one as we have said in the division and according to what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the section on worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine illness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called in some lands bovine illness because often among them there is a worm of which one is born between the skin and the flesh, and it moves throughout the body up and down, and it is shown by sensation beneath the skin from member to member until it breaks through the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Regarding the generation of worms is through the putrefaction of certain humors, just as it happens with worms and serpents and worms and grubs in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared because of its malice, for when it enters the body and rises to the head, and reaches the heart, immediately it burns strongly within and penetrates and destroys the heart, causing multiple dangers.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure that and extract it, then it is not done except by observing the movement and appearance of it to the sensation, and then you should press what is above it and what is below it tightly with bandages and constriction, and soon it dries up and extracts that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it penetrates into the flesh and you do not find it, then you should pause to cauterize with fire over the area where it resides, and the main cause that is feared is corruption of it by which it corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that it has reached the head near the heart, then press above the eyebrows with strong constriction, and soon dry up over it, and extract that; and it is necessary for the patient to use purification of his body with medicines evacuating bad putrid humors, and guard against foods generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the treatment of nasal afflictions.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called "nafir" in our land, and it is a pain that occurs in certain members of the body, and soon changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that as I will now recount to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I went to visit a sick woman in a village and uncovered her arm, where I found a small inflammation in the vena cephalica of the arm. After rinsing it for about an hour, I saw that this inflammation was moving just as a worm moves upwards, but more quickly than one would expect, like live silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then the pain moved from that location to the muscle, and it stayed there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it moved to the other side of her body until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then she told me that it was moving throughout her entire body as I observed; and I was very amazed by its movement and the speed with which it moved from one limb to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had seen something like this before in my own patients in that manner, but I have never seen pain being transferred from one limb to another so distinctly.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this in my patients as I did in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think this was possible except that the woman was of an elderly age, with weak limbs and exposed veins, and in her condition, this airiness or lightness could be perceived to move.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this does not appear according to this retrograde movement in those who are robust and have healthy limbs with veins preserved.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to treat it and the patient feels that pain, immediately apply pressure on that area and let it move quickly until that restricted airiness has passed, and then cauterize the location.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	If you do not use it to wash your hands, then treat that with an excursion of the body and with what expels windiness, and apply those against stinking pills and against pills of serape and similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of the extraction of splinters.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Splinters are varied according to their types and the parts of the body where they lodge, for their variety is such that some have large points, others small ones, concave or blunt tips; some are solid. There are those with three angles, and there are those that resemble tongues; and there are those that are like slender sticks.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And those that are according to the members and places where they lodge are in two ways: for the main members such as concavities, like the brain, heart, spine, lungs, ribs, bowels, bladder, and similar; therefore, when you find a splinter in any of these members and signs of death appear to you, which I will explain shortly, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting that splinter from those where death could occur due to major complications. And if such bad signs do not appear to you and the splinter is not hidden deep within the member, then you extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of a splinter in the brain are when it lodges in such a way that it penetrates the bone and emerges on the cephalic side, which is above the brain, caused by violent cold, scotoma, vertigo, rigidity in the hands, inflammation and burning of the tongue, spasms, confusion of understanding, vomiting of bile, and often speech is lost and the voice destroyed. Humid white matter similar to powder exits from the affected area, and the appearance shows swelling of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	Therefore, if I show you these signs, then you should refrain from treatment and the extraction of the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	Mark the signs of the arrow when it hits the heart, so that it is near the left nipple, and feel there whether it is fixed in hard tissue, not soft; and light the movement of the arrow resembles the pulse movement, and causes black blood to flow, and chills those parts, and cold sweat breaks out, and fainting occurs; therefore you will know that death descends soon.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has struck the lung are frothy blood from the wound, and the veins near the neck are swollen, and the complexion of the patient changes, and he breathes out great sighs, and seeks to draw in cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow hits the membrane that is in the thighs, and the pain then is near the small ribs, and it causes great and violent pain and sighing, and there is no strength left in all the limbs of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow hits the stomach, then very little of the food in the wound is digested.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow hits the abdomen, and it is lodged there, with some part of the wound torn, whether it be muscle, membrane, or bowel, which is ruptured, then there is no hope for recovery from the extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow hits the bladder, and urine comes out from it, and some part of it extends outward, and there is pain over the patient, then you will know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Like other members also as in the face, the neck, and the throat, and the shoulders and the helpers, and the vertebrae of the back, and the collarbone, and the rib and things similar to these members, they are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not find a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount this to you about the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand thereby about their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The reason for this is that when an arrow was embedded in the lacrimal bone of his eye at the root of the nose, I extracted it from him on the other side, left the granules behind in the ear canal, and he healed without any harm coming to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew, which had embedded in his eye within the canal, leaving the eyelid intact. The arrow was already concealed and only a small part of it could be reached to which the shaft adhered. It was a large sharp arrow of those used by Turkish warriors, with barbs but no grooves.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew recovered, and no harmful incident occurred to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who had it embedded in his throat, and it was an Arabic arrow, which had barbs; then I incised around that between two guidelines, and it was already submerged in his throat; then I carefully removed it, and the Christian man recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who had it embedded in his abdomen, and he was thought to die because of it; but after thirty days had passed and there was no change in his condition, I incised around the arrow and removed it, and he recovered without any harmful incident.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And there was a man in whom an arrow had been embedded at the base of his neck, and the injury had healed around it, but after seven years the arrow came out from the root of the collarbone.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And there was a woman in whom an arrow had struck her abdomen, and the injury had healed internally around it, and she did not experience any change in her condition, nor did she suffer any difficulties with her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And there was another man in whom an arrow struck his face, and the injury healed, but the arrow remained embedded without causing any pain, and similar cases are known.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And the arrow was extracted from the man who was the prince of the king; it had struck near the midpoint of his nose and had slightly deviated to the right, and the entire arrow was hidden inside.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him after the arrow had been embedded in him for about three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I found the wound of the arrow quite narrow; and then I examined it carefully, but did not feel any sensation there; however, he felt a pain below his right ear, and thus I suspected that this pain was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied a plaster to the area that had drawing and digestive properties, believing that it would cause the area to swell so that the location of the arrowhead would become apparent.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And no significant reaction occurred in the area where I believed the arrowhead to be; and I continued to apply the plaster for several days without any incident; meanwhile, the wound began to heal, and after about three days, he felt the arrow inside his nose and informed me of this.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Then I applied an acute corrosive medicine for several days until it penetrated the sore, and when I tried to test this, I found the tip of the arrowhead fine, which adheres to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then I adjusted the opening of the sore with that acute medicine until the tip of the arrowhead became visible to me, and it took me time for this over a period of four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the sore had become enlarged and I was able to introduce forceps into it, and removed that [foreign object], without any harm occurring, then I ceased trying other methods of removal, until one day I used those specific instruments designed for this purpose, as will be shown in their form at the end of the chapter, to extract that [object]; and afterward I treated that sore.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, but I did restore it, and the sore healed, and the patient was completely healthy without any further cause for concern.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I advise you regarding the quality of extracting some arrows so that you may apply this rule and its significance to what I have not mentioned, for the parts of this art and the definitions of these matters are not comprehensible in narration nor understood from the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.
