And skilled artisans compare with few words; and with what is present regarding what is absent; and they discover new operations and new instruments from the descent of causes external to the art when such occasions arise.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not expelled from the members in which they are embedded except in two ways: either by attraction to the place where they enter; or by the opposite part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	Of that which is pierced by the place where it entered, or is a dart proceeding in a fleshy place, and is pulled out and extracted.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if he does not obey the order to vomit at the hour when you catch it, wait some days until the flesh around it heals, and then ease its attraction to it and its exit.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is embedded in bone and he does not obey to vomit, then wait some days and gradually ease its attraction and motion each day, and it will be extracted.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if he does not obey to vomit even after some days, then you should drill around the arrow in that bone with a fine awl until the place is enlarged enough for the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is embedded in the bone of the head and has penetrated one of the ventricles of the brain, and if any of those symptoms that I have mentioned appear in the illness, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it until his condition stabilizes after some days; for if the arrow reaches the cerebrum, death is not prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is embedded only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the cerebrum, and the illness remains for some days without any cause of those symptoms occurring, then you should devise a way to ease the attraction of the arrow and his condition.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is firmly embedded and he does not obey your extraction order, then you should administer drills around the arrow as we have recommended, and afterwards treat the area until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the artery is hidden in the body and is concealed from feeling, then you inquire by touching that area, and if you feel it there, then direct that to some instruments which are suitable for attracting it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the artery, and here there is neither bone nor vein, then you operate on the wound until it is enlarged and it is possible to extract the artery.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is adhered to the ears with those parts, then you remove the flesh in which it is embedded entirely as much as you can; and work on that, if you cannot do so by separating the flesh from the fractures of the ears and twisting them until it loosens.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in whatever place it is, then you use twisting with your hand and forceps in all ways until it obeys; and do so carefully with the utmost care that the arrow does not break and that it is made easier to attract it and extract it.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot do this at that time, then you leave it for several days until the parts around it heal, and later attempt it when it is more convenient.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if there is an adverse flow of blood, then you administer what we have said about treatment in the relevant chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard against injuring the vein, nerve, or tendon, and administer treatment in every possible way to avoid disturbing these structures; do this with ease, tranquility, deliberation, and firmness as I advise.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore, you should make the splint curved so that the patient lies according to the figure according to which you should place the splint in it, for it is more helpful.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If that is not possible for you, now administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	However, for splints that are removed from the opposite side or where you have already processed some part outwardly, if there is stiffness at the extremity of the splint due to the part beneath the shoulder propelling it up and making it prominent; then you should cut above that; and let the cutting be according to the amount in which the forceps take hold; and immediately pull out that part, for it has been made light enough by this method.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	However, if it is retained in the bone, now you should twist the lamina in the opposite direction to which the splint presses against the bone, and enlarge it as you insert, and then extract that part.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave that for several days, and then try again when the time is right.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the splint shaft is in that position, now you should push it out from there.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	However, if the shaft is embedded and you want to administer pressure, now insert and use it; if it is dull, use a concave instrument so that it fits into the cavity of the splint at its base and then push it out from there.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	However, if the splint is concave, now you should push it out using a strong instrument by inserting it, for the splint is lightened by this method.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the bandage is poisoned, now you must hollow out all the flesh in which the poison lies, as much as it is possible for you to do so, and then treat that with what is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the bandage sticks to the feet, or to the belly, or to the bladder, or to the side, and it is close so that you touch it with the probe, and it is possible for you to cut over it, now cut over it and guard against injuring a vein or nerve, and extract it, and then treat the wound as seems necessary, and cure it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which bandages are removed:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the extremities of these be shaped like the beak of a bird, which is made like a clamp when they grasp the bandage so that they do not let it go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And from these are made various special hooks, large, few and medium-sized, according to the quantity of the bandage's size and its narrowness, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of an impelling concave on this extremity that is curved like the claw of a bird so that it may ease the instrument for removing the bandage, and the force with which it pushes:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of an impelling hook-shaped extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Like a rod so that it may ease the instrument into the concave bandage and is pushed with it.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins for phlebotomy of which one usually performs bloodletting, there are thirty, of which sixteen are in the head. Of these, two pulsating veins, which are near the ears, called alhasisain; two branches that appear on each temple; and two veins that are in the two tear ducts by the eyes, which are called aspicientz; and the vein prepared in the middle of the forehead, and the vein at the tip of the nose; and two tendons which are near the neck; and two veins that are in the upper lip; and two veins that are in the lower lip; and these are the veins that are called algelic; and there are two veins below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are five. Of these, one is called cephalic, and it resembles the wild thyme; and people call it "the vein of the head," and it is also called sorda, and it is a median vein, composed of a branch from the basilic vein, and another branch from the cephalic vein; and they call this one among the common people "vein of the whole body"; and basilica is the vein that lies on the domestic side, and it is called "little finger," and the common people name this "abdominal vein." And there are tendons in the arm, and it lies over the humerus, and this is where bloodletting is performed, and it appears prominently on the forearm; and salvatella is the vein that lies between the thumb and the little finger, and these are in both sides.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the leg and the thigh there are three veins. One of these is behind the curvature of the wild thyme side; and the second is sophena, and its location is behind the domestic thigh; and the sciatic vein, and its location is behind the wild thigh; and in the thigh there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of veins near the ears is for catarrhs, emigrations, and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of opening those veins is as I recommend to you: shave the patient's head and rub it well at the occipital region where the two veins are; press down on the patient’s neck with a bandage so that the two veins appear near each ear in two locations lower on the head; and feel for them with your finger, and if you can sense the pulse of those veins with your finger, here is when to proceed.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the lancet, and use that which is sharp, and then insert it below the vein along the groove until the blood reaches the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand with the vein and its groove upwards and cut the vein with a sharp incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the incision should be about two fingers' width or slightly more; and let as much blood out as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then apply pressure with a pad and leave it there until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already at the beginning of the book, I have described the incision and cauterization of those veins.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But for the two arteries near the temples, the treatment of phlebotomy is for old and persistent migraines, acute suppurating conditions in the eyes, and severe accumulations of excess fluids around the eyes.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomy of those arteries is as I recommend to you: have the patient press their neck with force until the two veins become visible clearly, and demonstrate the pulse of those veins with your finger; then you may proceed.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Raise the vein above the ligature to the parts above with your finger, and insert the phlebotomy knife below, raising the vein up; and cut it as you did for the two other veins; let the blood flow according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then loosen the compression on the patient, and place your finger on the vein for one hour, then place it over that cut and apply pressure with the palm and fingers firmly around it, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And the reminder of them has been mentioned before, and their incision and attraction have been described at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And thus, the procedure of phlebotomy of the frontal vein is similar to the cephalic vein phlebotomy for ancient illnesses of the face and for migraines, rigors, and foul-smelling ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the phlebotomy is as I recommend to you; that is, the patient should hold their arm with a cloth until the vein appears; then take the instrument called a trocar, which has this shape:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place the sharp point of the trocar at the head of the instrument over that vein and press it down on it either tilted or for some other reason as described, and let the blood flow according to the quantity you desire; then loosen the puncture of the patient and hold it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And in some cases, phlebotomy of the lat (a vein) is performed, but it is not necessary for the phlebotomy to be sharp like other phlebotomies; rather, it should be blunt. Perform this phlebotomy transversely, as the bone is close and strong, and the phlebotomy might easily break it if it were fine.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	Here is the English translation:
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	Of the quality of phlebotomy is that the patient strains his neck with a bandage, and then you perform phlebotomy on those areas, and you should stand above his head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And phlebotomy should be performed across the length a bit apart from each phlebotomy, because in that place there is no flesh; and if the phlebotomy is delicate, then the extremity of it is easily broken.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then let the blood flow as much as is necessary for you, and pause on those cuts, and strain those for one night, and then remove them.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But phlebotomy of the nasal vein is appropriate for acute fever and violent sweating, and for illnesses of the face and migraines and pain that occur in the face, especially when they are chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of this phlebotomy is that the patient strains his own neck and then with your left hand hold his nose, take a delicate lancet long and place it in the middle part of the nose cap straight, because the vein does not appear by touch here, and because the blood begins to flow immediately.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Make sure you end your hand with the small phlebotomy gradually and let the blood flow according to your necessity; and then bind it for one night, because that area is quickly restored.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the harm of phlebotomy of the two veins leads to constriction of breath and the beginning of leprosy and many illnesses and impetigo and severe corrosive ulcers as well as herpes.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of phlebotomy of those veins is that the patient strains each one in his neck with a bandage; and the practitioner should stand above the patient's head, and the patient should sit on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	For in phlebotomy, when opening the long vein, do it gradually with small cuts; and then extract blood according to the season or quantity needed as required by necessity; and afterward make an appearance like the other veins.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then loosen the bandage and gently stretch the two veins where there is constriction so that the patient is not overstrained, and wait until the ailment is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And for the benefit of phlebotomy of the larger veins, it is also useful for small abscesses and pus-filled boils in the mouth, corruption of the gums, bad ulcers, and cracks, as well as for bad ulcers that occur on the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of phlebotomy from these veins is that you should have the patient facing you, and tie a bandage around their neck, and then spread out their lips and observe the two veins, one on the right side of the lip and the second on the left; and the demonstration of each is by the darkness of each, and this is more evident because in the area around these there are small black veins; and then incise each with a cutting incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if you are in doubt and do not know which one it is, then incise the larger of these veins, and from those that show pus.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the appearance of the two veins that are above the lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But it is more common to cut the two veins that are on the lower lip.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But for the two veins that are below the tongue, the benefit is in phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for fainting that occurs in the throat, for diseases of the uvula, and for illnesses of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	Of the quality of phlebotomy it is that follow the patient among thy more before the sun, and raise the tongue of him, and regard below the tongue, from one side of the vein and from the other side vein, and the color of each is declining to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	Then phlebotomize each one; and be careful that you do not use your hand in phlebotomy below those, for below those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are phlebotomized in the bend where it runs customarily throughout all men, and the phlebotomy of them is done according to two methods, either place next to the phlebotomy a small mirror or an olive pit with subtle gradations; or hold the phlebotomy knife steadily, and feel if it is steady, and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this steadiness is what befits the section and of those their special side and subtle according to the width of the veins and according to the tightness of them.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of phlebotomy with a mirror:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the side of it be as such when times, and befits to open veins that are concave and full proceeding from visible thick vessels, and for those which contain thick coagulated blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of phlebotomy with an olive pit:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this phlebotomy is of lesser width and more subtle extremity, and befits the phlebotomy of fine veins which contain thin quick blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of phlebotomy of the basilica vein, which is one of three veins: for it extracts blood from diseases that are below the jaw and neck, and from what dries the legs and abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And when performing a venesection, one should be very careful and have great fear of hitting an artery, for if the vein is punctured incorrectly and the incision is made in the artery instead, it will cut that artery and cause a surge of blood to flow out, so it is necessary not to use a sharp instrument for venesection but rather one that is blunt like an onion.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica vein does not appear clearly, then it is necessary to leave that one and switch to another; or to look for some branch vein; or to perform venesection at the end of the arm where it is clear; and make that venesection with a blunt instrument as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the venesection of the median vein, then before the constriction of the arm, touch the place between where you know the location of the wrists, and slightly above where it is thin; and lift the arm and make the incision on the concave side with a blunt instrument as we have said; and be careful not to hit the artery in that area.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you press, as you tighten the ligature, if there is swelling in the place that you marked as thin, then that swelling is arterial swelling, and therefore avoid that area.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if the blood flows from the venesection as it does in a child’s urination, and the blood is fine and red, then you know that it is arterial blood; and at that moment, hold your finger on that spot for a long period; and after remove your finger, and if the bleeding stops, because several times it has stopped, then tighten the arm and leave that area.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	Guard the patient from the blowing of air, and let them be overcautious about it and do not touch that for any days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	If the blood does not clot, and if you do not have appropriate medicine available at that time, then incise the artery, if it appears to you; for the extremity of it is contracted, and the blood is severed; or take silk thread and place it there, and take half of it and tightly bind it over the site of the vein with descent and powders inside on the other day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the blood is clotted, that is good; but if not, then treat it with what precedes regarding the memory of the location of the powders to stop the flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the clotting of the blood from it is difficult in many positions due to the small location of the wound and the possibility of binding the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But for the dark vein, phlebotomy is helpful to extract blood from the upper part of the head and from below the chest; by this means, which is composed of branches of the basilica and of the cephalic vein, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is important for the phlebotomist to be extremely cautious during the phlebotomy of that area, as below it lies a nerve; and then if there is an error in the puncture of the phlebotomy and the nerve is hit, it will cause numbness, and healing from this is difficult, and rarely can one recover completely. And this nerve appears to many people through sensation; and if it is hidden from some individuals and is subtle and not shown, then it is important that you pause the phlebotomy where you perform it in the region of weakness, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you should divide the vein along its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is that it attracts blood from the head and relieves eye diseases.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And here it is appropriate, if you want the phlebotomist to puncture either an olive vein or a myrtle vein; for it is the safest of all veins, as it is neither close to arteries nor nerves.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is necessary for you to ensure that when performing phlebotomy, you do not puncture the head of the lizard vein alone, but seek a place farther away and do not mark it unless after the first percussion it is evident that there are no veins nearby.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, it is often the case that an abscess appears in some people when they are not phlebotomized on the first attempt, so do not mark that abscess.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	However, the quality of the phlebotomy of that vein and its consequences should be carefully considered for their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is about knowing that phlebotomy should be administered only for the preservation of health and with hope and caution against the onset of diseases. It should be performed on one of the veins located in the arm, which are: cephalic, basilic, and fusca; and it should be done at the beginning of spring, after breakfast in spring and autumn, and in winter near mealtime when signs of fullness appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And let phlebotomy be performed when the third hour has passed since the first pus appeared.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	And let phlebotomy be administered whenever there is convenience and necessity for it, whether by night or day, at any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And it is not proper to perform phlebotomy on a child until they are fourteen years old, and do not perform phlebotomy on a woman who is pregnant unless it is during the fourth month and before the seventh, and do not perform phlebotomy on women who have passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wishes to undergo phlebotomy by any method, it is necessary for them to clean their bowels before the phlebotomy with a laxative enema if there is retained fecal matter in them, so that the veins do not carry superfluous substances during the phlebotomy of the purified bowels, and so they do not affect the principal limbs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And do not perform phlebotomy on patients who are suffering from severe nausea and drunkenness, or who are recovering from illness or intoxication until these effects have subsided, nor on those with dropsy. Also, be cautious about performing phlebotomy near the onset of colic pain and vomiting, and after abdominal issues, and during times of excessive sexual activity, work, exercise, fasting, or wakefulness, and any cause that weakens the body's strength, whether physical or mental.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And before considering phlebotomy, carefully observe the subtlety of the humors, especially if the blood is thick, through food and drinks, and with medicines if that is possible.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And before phlebotomy, take a bath if there is no cause prohibiting it, or exercise for some time to make the blood thinner.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And the phlebotomy of that day is performed at about the hour of tierce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And you should perform it when the day is free from all bad animal accidents, such as anguish, anger, fear, and from all excessive bodily activities, such as hard work, unnecessary pain, grief, and similar things.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And at his side, have present the causes in the use of which people usually find pleasant aromatics and odors and balms and similar things according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And the phlebotomist should sit on a chair that is higher than the chair of the person who needs to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And nearby, draw out their arm, and wash it with his hand by the phlebotomist two or three times; and then bind the ligature with a cord and wrap it around twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And the ligature should be applied promptly, for if it is not done at the right time or if it is too tight, it prevents the flow of blood; or if it is too loose, it also fails to control the blood properly.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And after the ligature is applied, have the person who needs to be phlebotomized wash their hands together until the veins become swollen and are clearly visible.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And then the phlebotomist anoints their phlebotomy needle with a little proper olive oil; and then places his left hand index finger on that vein, just below the place where the phlebotomy is to be performed, so that the vein withdraws slightly, and the percussion is steady because among the veins is one that feels like a fleeing cord for phlebotomy, and in this one there is air; when you apply the phlebotomy, it does not puncture the vein, and if it does puncture, then that vein is narrow.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	Therefore, let the phlebotomist be fixed in place and attentive to all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And immediately after the phlebotomy, if the vein is open in one place, then that is sufficient; and if not, repeat this at another place, leaving that location for a while, or apply some heat to it, if the area is not inflamed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the area is inflamed or the patient becomes worse, then you should leave it for one day or two, and do not tighten the bandage, for it will surely cause inflammation, nor should you enter a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And immediately repeat the phlebotomy if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the incision is small and blood flows slightly, and you fear that not enough blood will flow as desired, then repeat the phlebotomy at that spot carefully and adjust the incision slightly, and apply some heat before the area becomes inflamed, for the area tends to become inflamed with even a slight incision in most people.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that the area is already inflamed, then do not repeat it there, for it will not help in any way; and apply some part of the incision with oil, for it aids the flow of blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And in this case, oil is better than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly, administer oil on the incision in every phlebotomy where you open veins that are prohibited by the constitution of the blood, and use either theriac or Syrian wine when paused from one of these, for the blood becomes thinner and less congested.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the place of phlebotomy a large abscess is generated, which happens often, especially to those who have not been bled recently or only slightly upon the vein's opening, then you should treat it, and apply over the area a sponge infused with water and salt, somewhat heated, and hold that there for one hour, because it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And do this near the exit of the blood from that vein or from another vein, with caution.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if after some days a black or greenish discoloration remains in the area, do not be concerned about it; and if you wish, apply to that area a preparation of aloes and myrrh dissolved, or a preparation of mint juice or collyrium or something similar.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And often there occur abscesses and swellings that require phlebotomy from the basilic vein.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore place your hand on that area, and if you find softness upon compression there, then that swelling is bad; and then be careful not to apply any of the substances we have mentioned over it, for the blood will easily flow from an artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And apply a plaster that has astringent properties to harden the area, and then treat it with other remedies until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And it is necessary to extract blood from a person according to the quantity of their vitality and according to the appearance and color of the blood as it appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, then let it flow until it becomes red; and similarly, if you see it thick, then let it flow until it becomes thin; and similarly, if it is acute, until its sharpness is moderated.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	For those who are full and strong and have a need for bloodletting at one time, the phlebotomy of the vein should be enlarged and let the bleeding be slow.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for those who are weak, do the opposite of that, and let it be done in small amounts at different times, and let the incision be shallow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best to be used in venous phlebotomy is a transverse section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this method of phlebotomy is safe from blood flow and nerve injury, and it is more beneficial and safer than phlebotomy according to latitude and longitude.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And for those who are accustomed to fainting due to phlebotomy, you should treat them before the phlebotomy with a small amount of bread infused in vinegar made from millet or simple oxymel heated; and extract the blood in three or four sessions.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is applied as a plaster before phlebotomy, then take bread infused in syrup of myrrh or in aromatic honey mixed with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar, or in an aromatic syrup with good fragrance.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if fainting occurs due to phlebotomy and is caused by the loss of vital blood, then it is necessary to drink water and a subtle fragrant syrup; and use aromatics with rose water, and apply them to their pulse points.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes that we have mentioned in the division in the chapter on fainting due to evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And for one who wishes to open the vein and dissolve the blood for a second time, it is appropriate to use the feather whose virtue is that of iron, which gradually evacuates the blood little by little, according to the quantity of its virtue over continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	And for one who wishes to open the vein and remove their blood for a second time, and whose body is strong, he should do this about seven or nine hours after the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	And for one who wishes to draw the blood from their body contrary to the side towards which it inclines, they should be bled on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	And for a body in which there is already heated and thickened blood causing fever, it should be drawn out once, and a large quantity of blood should be taken, until fainting occurs, while maintaining all the conditions of phlebotomy; and place your hand on the pulse to stop when the blood has been sufficiently removed, so that death does not occur instead of fainting, as this often happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And when you wish to open the vein and evacuate the blood for a second time, since the orifices of the vein are already closed and it is difficult for the blood to flow out, do not press too forcefully or bend it suddenly, as this is harmful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Handle the area gently until you are ready for a second phlebotomy; or move this side when the sharpness of the phlebotomy has caused coagulation in the vein's orifice; or pause and apply something of thyraca alfarach, or sage, and compress it lightly until the blood flows out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, do not touch it then, but wait until the inflammation subsides.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity compels you to evacuate the blood secondarily, and there is no excuse, then bleed that person at that site or in another vein on the other arm.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And when the vein called "the cord of the arm" is phlebotomized in place of the fusca or the basilica, which are not obscured or hidden, because it is composed of these.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient immerse his hand in cold water until it turns red and the vein becomes clearly apparent.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then tightly apply a ligature over that vein at the midpoint of its course; and then perform phlebotomy transversely along the small crosswise line, not latitudinally or longitudinally.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And make the incision wide, and perform your phlebotomy on that vein near the joint of the hand a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is restricted, then immerse the hand in cold water and let the blood run into the water until you achieve your purpose.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are during the days of summer, then you are exempt from immersing your hand in cold water, and similarly, in winter, pause the process of cooling the body with water.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than that of all other veins, because there are no pulsating vessels or nerves nearby.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the vein on the right hand is appropriate for diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that you tighten your hand or another person's hand, after placing it in hot water until the vein becomes swollen and is clearly visible to the onlooker; then cut across that vein transversely; and if you do not incise it entirely, nothing will come of this.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And do not hold onto the hand during the phlebotomy, for afterwards you must treat the exposed nerves of the aforementioned area.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then immerse the hand in hot water and let the blood flow there, for if you do not immerse it in hot water, the blood will coagulate at the venous opening, hindering the flow.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood is extracted in the required quantity, then press on the vein with oil and salt so that it does not close too quickly; similarly, ensure you do this properly throughout the procedure.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	And the use of phlebotomy from the vein on the left hand is appropriate for diseases of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And perform the phlebotomy in the same manner as you did with the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the use of the cephalic vein in phlebotomy is for diseases that affect the lower part of the body, such as disorders of the uterus, and for retention of menstruation, and for diseases of the joints and ulcers of old wounds, and similar conditions.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	Of the quality of phlebotomy it is that the patient plunges his arm into hot water and performs friction thereon until the veins become visible; and he places a cord over the joint of the arm, and the place of the vein appears above the said joints, and from which those branches extend across the face of the arm in various directions.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And so the phlebotomy should be performed on the largest branch below the elbow near the wrist, for it is better and more effective.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform phlebotomy on that area of the arm's surface, then be careful of the nerves which are below it on the arm's surface, and stop your phlebotomy when you reach a point where you would otherwise cut across, as if you were trying to divide it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And so the phlebotomy is finished.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the letting of blood is prohibited; then you should immerse the arm in hot water again and allow the blood to flow in that area until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs on the first attempt, then repeat the phlebotomy above it slightly, for that location is effective; and do not fear this mistake, but be careful of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do the phlebotomy of the other arm in the same manner.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the location is as we have said, below the thigh behind the knee.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of phlebotomy is to alleviate pain in the side when one is suffering from excessive blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	Of the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient enter into a bath, and hasten and strain the body from the width between the thighs up to above the heel in four places with a long slender bandage, for it appears only by this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to each angle as is possible and according to the transverse, which is better; or incise that by incision or section it by cutting, for the place of it is salt.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in the words of a man slightly weakened; and if you find that, and it does not appear to the sense of all, then phlebotomize some branch of it, and that is the one which appears between the two of the hand behind the ring finger and the little finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful of the nerves, and let the amount of blood flow that you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the bandage and pause over the place of the phlebotomy to strain the place, for it is quickly healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of venotomy and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Venotomies are usually from horns, or arteries, or veins.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And venotomy is done in two ways: one of them is as incision and extraction of blood, and the other is venotomy without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this venotomy that is without incision is in two ways, for it can be with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for the venotomies that are administered with incision and extraction of blood there are fourteen locations on the body, of which one is where a venotomy is usually paused at the back of the head; and another middle location is at both sides of the neck; and venotomies of the chin below the jaw beside the mouth; and venotomies of the two cheeks; and venotomies of alohoster, which is above the earlobe; and venotomies of the two forearms; and venotomies of the two thighs; and venotomies of the two feet.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Of bloodletting we take the blood not from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and thereby we do not capture the virtue through those, just as it happens with phlebotomy; nor is it necessary for bloodletting to be done near a fire or without a fire in any disease caused by retention until the entire body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If necessity prompts bloodletting due to illness or continuously, administer that at any time at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and at whatever interval may be appropriate.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that in certain individuals, blood is multiplied within them to such an extent that they require its extraction through bloodletting and find relief in their head and temples; and among these are those who experience congestion and hardness in their face and head, and in their neck; and among these are those who show puffiness in their face and forehead, darkness and dullness in their eyes; and among these is the location for bloodletting apparent; and among these is an increase in laughter observed; and among these is a taste of blood in their mouth, or their tongue becomes coated with phlegm and they spit out blood; and among these is excessive sleep noticed, and those who see blood during sleep along with hardness, tremors, plagues, and other similar causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And when you encounter any of those causes, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, I command that bloodletting be performed after two or three hours have passed from midday.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of bloodletting from the neck is that when it relieves heaviness in the head and also what has settled in the eyes; but it should be done after the evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this vein is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic region.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not good to use that which is of full friction, or in which there is a cold, because it gives great harm to the patient.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason, it is not advisable to use those veins, and in the heads of which there are usually fresh illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But for the one who continues above that, forgetfulness is caused by it; and for this reason, you should command the vein-bleeder to pause his hand a little bit behind, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But phlebotomy of the temporal region is in the place of venesection of the dark vein and of the basilic vein: and for this it is beneficial for asthma, and for constriction of breath, and for rupture of the breathing organ, and for coughs, and for excess.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary to raise the temporal vein a little, for if it is lowered too much, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the phlebotomy of the occipital region is beneficial for accidental pains in the head and for ophthalmia, headache, coryza, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of venesection of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary to command the vein-bleeder not to press his hand near the incision so that he does not injure the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And phlebotomy below the chin is beneficial for alcohol in the mouth, and for corruption of the gums, and for symptoms similar to those illnesses that are in the mouth, and it is in the place of venesection of the alheric vein which is on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	Avoid the windiness that is made between the two spatulas by applying a bandage, which is made by filling it with heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And for the windiness between the two parts inside the armpits, apply forcefully the phlebotomy of three veins, which are the basilic, fusca, and cephalic, because they attract blood from all the smaller veins that are in the flesh, and these small veins from the other larger veins until the attraction reaches those three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the wind operator not to proceed with incisions, because the area is bare of flesh, and leave it as it is with nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a windlass with which you apply suction over the hemorrhoids of the anus and to ulcers while leaving them exposed.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you should command the wind operator to use a large windlass and make it of leather, because the area you are treating requires strong drying; and for severe cases, use gentle suction with subtle windlasses and apply incisions carefully.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Avoid windlasses on minor areas carefully and distinctly, for they draw blood from the entire body, and apply them to old pains in the loins and back, and to the bladder; and they induce menstruation, and apply them to boils and abscesses; and they serve as a substitute for phlebotomy of two saphenas, the alahorcoben, and two cavilhas.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the entire body and can cause fainting in some people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And for the windlasses on the alahorcoben, the force should be proportionate to the force used in windlasses on two cheeks.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	Of the quality of the position of the cupping vessels is that you place the vessel at the beginning empty and suck it moderately, and do not prolong the position of the cupping vessels, but pause them gently, and remove them cautiously, so that the humors come to the place by occurrence equal.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this and continue until you see the place already red and swollen, and the hardness of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And now you should incise and repeat the suction gradually, and then observe the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For the person who has tender flesh with few pores should be incised once and not pressed, so that the area is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the cupper to enlarge the incision slightly and to prolong it a bit, and to moderate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, now you should incise twice, for in the first incision the way of subtlety to the blood and to its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second for the acquired scrutiny of extracting the thick blood.
